<Text: La dame blanche:  The opera has typical elements of the Romantic in its Gothic mode, including an exotic Scottish locale, a lost heir, a mysterious castle, a hidden fortune, and a ghost, in this case benevolent.>
Triplets:<La dame blanche
3:
--------------------
Text: La dame blanche:  The work was one of the first attempts to introduce the fantastic into opera and is a model for works such as Giacomo Meyerbeer's "Robert le diable" and Charles Gounod's "Faust".
Triplets:<La dame blanche
4:
--------------------
Text: La dame blanche:  The opera's musical style also heavily influenced later operas like "Lucia di Lammermoor", "I puritani" and "La jolie fille de Perth".
